textfields.tf: When the vehicle frame is positioned below or above driving level, the steering behavior and the brake characteristics are influenced.
When the vehicle frame is positioned below driving level, the spring travel is decreased. Due to this the chassis and the frame may be damaged during driving.
Du to the reduction of the spring travel the cargo may be damaged.
Otherwise the supporting bellows could burst during driving, caused by resulting pressure peaks.
Before starting the driving level has to be achieved. Why?
This statement is true: The steering behavior and the brake characteristics are influenced by the distance between the axle and the superstructure.
This statement is true. Due to the reduced spring travel some parts of the vehicle may be damaged.
This statement is true. Due to the reduced spring travel even the cargo can be damaged.
This statement is wrong. Another level cannot cause so a pressure growth.
